name: vmwVmNetTable
description: Table of network adapters (nic) for all vms in vmwVmTable.

.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.1.name: vmwVmNetVmIdx
.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.1.description: This number corresponds to vmwVmIdx in vmwVmTable.

.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.2.name: vmwVmNetIdx
.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.2.description: Identifies a unique network adapter in this table. Not guaranteed to be the same across system reboots.

.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.3.name: vmwVmNetNum
.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.3.description: The name of the device as it appears in the VM Settings. VIM Property: Virtual Device's with index of 4000-4999. MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=config%2ehardware

.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.4.name: vmwVmNetName
.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.4.description: What this virutal nic is connected to such as a virtual switch portgroup identifier. VIM Property: Virtual Device's with index of 4000-4999. MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=config%2ehardware then select property 'backing' to how this nic connects. If no backing was defined by operator, string will start with W: If unavailable, string will start with E:

.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.5.name: vmwVmNetConnType
.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.5.description: Do not use this value, and should an agent return it discard it.

.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.6.name: vmwVmNetConnected
.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.6.description: Reports 'true' if the ethernet virtual device is connected to the virtual machine.

.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.7.name: vmwVmMAC
.1.3.6.1.4.1.6876.2.4.1.7.description: Reports the configured virtual hardware MAC address. If VMware Tools is not running, or VM has not yet been powered on for the first time and mac is to be generated by VM then the value is zero'd out/empty. VIM Property: Virtual Device's with index of 4000-4999. MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=config%2ehardware
